com.sana.android.plugin.data.event

Class BaseDataEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sana.android.plugin.data.event.BaseDataEvent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccelerometerDataEvent, BytePollingDataEvent, BytePushingDataEvent, MockEvent, UsbHostDeviceDataEvent

    public abstract class BaseDataEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    The base abstract data event class. It provides support for updating clients new data as they are captured by the sensors. Concrete implementations should override the startEvent() and stopEvent() methods and use the notifyListeners(Object[]) methods to get the listeners notified.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BaseDataEvent(java.lang.Object sender)
      The source of data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseDataEvent

        public BaseDataEvent(java.lang.Object sender)
        The source of data. Although there is no restriction on who should be the sender. In principle it should be one of the GeneralDevice implementations.
        Parameters:
        sender -

    • Method Detail

      • getSender

        public java.lang.Object getSender()

      • notifyListeners

        public void notifyListeners(java.lang.Object[] data)
        Notify the listeners of new data. Each listener will be notified by threads in a cached thread pool.
        Parameters:
        data -

      • addListener

        public boolean addListener(DataListener listener)
        Add a listener to the event. You can add the same listener object multiple times but it will only be notified once in the event of an update.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(DataListener listener)

      • removeAllListeners

        public void removeAllListeners()

      • startEvent

        public abstract void startEvent()
        Start the data event. The principle is that before this method is called by the user, the listeners should never get any data update; and after it is called and when some condition is met, the listeners must get updated.

      • stopEvent

        public abstract void stopEvent()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        After calling this method, the event should finish the current notification task after which no more notifications should be made.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - generally many data events are associated with some IO resources so the caller should expect to catch exceptions.
